main event: Multiple round, dime-sized objects were observed in the sky over Globe, Arizona on November 25, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were observed to pass one another in a straight line.
The objects were initially described as being the size of dimes.
The sighting lasted for approximately 3 minutes.
The objects were possibly identified as balloons or aircraft, but the conclusion was that the sighting was unknown.
Another sighting in Globe, Arizona on October 6, 1957 was also reported, involving a witness named Mrs. Allison.
